content: s too loose remove the seam and remove row until you have the fit you d like but make sure to seam your hat again before moving on to the next step while your project is still inside out weave the tail through each row at this end of your hat under one row then over the next when you ve worked your way around the circumference of the hat cinch the yarn to close the hat knot your yarn in place and give your beanie a few additional stitches at the top to secure secure and cut your yarn and weave in any ends sew in a label add embroidery or a cute pin wear it slouchy or folded up and enjoy sharing your work online please tag @woolintentions #woolintentions #fishermanbeanie i d love to see your work wool intentions is rachael mason based in columbus ohio find wool intentions patterns on ravelry as rachael mason designs and on etsy at woolintentions etsy com this pattern may be printed and used for personal non-commercial use this pattern may not be reproduced sold or distributed without permission woolintentions com @woolintentions 3 © 2023 wool intentions all rights reserved
